dict.acceptation: 戏法，把戏；计谋，诀窍；骗局；恶作剧；
弄虚作假的；有诀窍的；欺诈的；

sent.orig: I ate so much candy after I went trick-or-treat that I was sick for a week.
sent.trans: 我去搞“trick-or-treat”之后吃的糖太多了，病了一个礼拜。

sent.orig: This investiture of the grotesqueimpossible with reality, he looked upon as a trick-a trick at best.
sent.trans: 他把这种荒诞离奇与现实的杂揉只认作是一种技巧——最多是一种聪明的技巧。

sent.orig: Well, psychologists have a trick up their sleeves. That trick is called moment-by-moment sampling.
sent.trans: 他们认为，因为拥有了权利和金钱，所以他们一定是幸福的。

sent.orig: At the morning news time, Rose, the magic girl, has another trick to show.
sent.trans: 早上的新闻时间，会很多魔术的罗丝又给大家表演。

sent.orig: A trick will only work for a while, until everyone else is doing it.
sent.trans: 把戏只能得逞一时，到人人会耍时就不灵了。
